channel.title: HECU splitter camo?
channel.description:
I was playing Half-life the other day and noticed that the HECU marines wore urban splitter camo, but in Gearbox's HD skin pack they just wear normal urban camo. So then I thought maybe someone could recreate the urban splitter camo in Black Mesa.
[url]https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/Hazardous_Environment_Combat_Unit[/url]

item.title: HECU splitter camo?
item.dc:creator: sgtpieman
item.description:
It’s labeled v1 in case I ever discover something in Black Mesa that would be really awesome for the grunts. There’s no confirmation for a v2, but it is a possibility.

Read full topic

item.title: HECU splitter camo?
item.dc:creator: Mashak
item.description:
Wonderful release!
And I’m to be intrigued by V1 label.
What exactly are you planning to do next?
My suggestion would be making clothing(not the camo, it’s great) more detailed, like pockets, lower part of jacket, and such? Because,while I love it and use it, it kind of looks like a jumpsuit instead of separate pieces of clothing.
Another suggestion would be making the new textures for vests, holsters, kneepads on the old camo.
And a question to whoever knows: is it possible to not have their hands clip through the gloves?

Read full topic

item.title: HECU splitter camo?
item.dc:creator: Mashak
item.description:
I have a couple questions/suggestions for your release, sgt, if you don’t mind:
1st: not everyone may like the urban camo helmet, but like the new gasmask, could you also make a version with old helmet, but with new gasmask?
2nd: some may have inferior computers,(though I’m sure you’re not going crazy with the filesize), it would be good idea to release smaller texture, little less detail,(I’ve seen retextures that only add patches, yet they increase the filesize by ten, which is completely unnecesarry.).
I’m sure someone may agree with me, so I hope I contributed somewhat.

Read full topic

item.title: HECU splitter camo?

item.description:
That’s a good idea that way it will make sense.

Read full topic

item.title: HECU splitter camo?
item.dc:creator: Hezus
item.description:
Nice work on those skins!

Fun fact is that Valve chose the camo not because of realism or story elements but because of the simple reason that they needed the soldiers to be distinguishable on the low resolution of 320x240. Effectivly it is anti-camo.

Before another heated discussion starts: this is a fact. Mentioned in Half-Life 2: Raising the Bar.

Read full topic

item.title: HECU splitter camo?
item.dc:creator: elevenbravo
item.description:
Remove the HECU and The unit patch on the BA on the front. They wouldn’t wear them on their kit. The only thing that is usually there is a rank and name tape. If you want their armor to look real, look around for some MTV pictures, (thats the marines version of the army IOTV) The Army IOTV has a place for flag, the marine one doesn’t. Although valves version looks more like the standard Iba

On the right hand sleave, right under it should also be a HECU patch. This is a deployment patch and I’d assume the majority of a unit like HECU would’ve been deployed already. The American flag on the right hand side would also be OD/TONED/infrared.

Read full topic
